dt: {bc}deserving to be {d_link|despised|despise} {bc}so worthless or obnoxious as to rouse moral {d_link|indignation|indignation}

pt: {sc}contemptible{/sc} {sc}despicable{/sc} {sc}pitiable{/sc} {sc}sorry{/sc} {sc}scurvy{/sc} mean arousing or deserving scorn. {sc}contemptible{/sc} may imply any quality provoking scorn or a low standing in any scale of values.
{sc}despicable{/sc} may imply utter worthlessness and usually suggests arousing an attitude of moral indignation.
{sc}pitiable{/sc} applies to what inspires mixed contempt and pity.
{sc}sorry{/sc} may stress pitiable inadequacy or may suggest wretchedness or sordidness.

pt.t: this rattletrap is a {it}sorry{/it} excuse for a car

pt: {sc}scurvy{/sc} adds to {sc}despicable{/sc} an implication of arousing disgust.

et: Late Latin {it}despicabilis{/it}, from Latin {it}despicari{/it} to despise
shortdef: deserving to be despised : so worthless or obnoxious as to rouse moral indignation
